isis.stitle: INSTRUMENTS - CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS - Internal Voltage Check

step1.para: Turn the key switch to OFF, remove the pyrometer gauge from the cluster and make sure the cluster harness connectors are properly installed in the cluster (refer to CLUSTER HARNESS CONNECTORS).

Turn the key switch to ACC and measure the voltage across the gauge's cluster pins. See the Electrical Circuit Diagrams Book, 2000, 4000, 8000. Pyrometer reference voltage is at Terminal 1, Sensor voltage at Terminal 3 and Ground at Terminal 2.

step2.para: If the proper voltages are not present, replace the cluster with a new gaugeless cluster.
If the voltages are correct, turn the key switch to OFF and reinstall the pyrometer gauge. Turn the key switch to ACC and if the gauge does not operate, replace the gauge.
